intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. actinoides, commonly known as the golden root, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters, and the root system is notable for its medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
